title: SMC_GCodeViewer (FunctionBlock)
text:
FUNCTION_BLOCK SMC_GCodeViewer
This function block produces a textual representation of the G-Code
that has been processed by
SMC_NCInterpreter
or
SMC_NCDecoder
.
This textual representation can be displayed in a visualization.
With the input
interpolatedObjectId
, typically connected with the
SMC_Interpolator
output
actObjectId
, the function block
gets the information which line has already been processed.  It
will remove the text of already processed lines.
Note
The output of the function block does not exactly match
the G-code stored in the editor or in the text file.
For example, no blank lines or comments will be output and
variables will be replaced with their value.
The function block is called in the same task as
SMC_NCInterpreter
.
The number of
SMC_GCODEVIEWER_DATA
objects in the buffer
pBuffer
must be at least as large as the sum of all buffer sizes of the
SMC_NCInterpreter
and the path-preprocessing function blocks.

rows.Name: GCodeText
rows.Comment:
Information about the interpreted GCode.
Intended to be connected to the output with the same name ofSMC_NCInterpreterorSMC_NCDecoder.

rows.Name: bEnable
rows.Comment:
The function block executes as long asbEnableisTRUE.
Enable must beTRUEas long as eitherSMC_NCInterpreterorSMC_Interpolatorare still busy.

rows: Identifier of the currently interpolated object of the path.

Size of the array that is passed bypBuffer.  The size
is in elements, not bytes.

Address of the array allocated as a buffer for the function
block

rows.Name: bError
rows.Comment:
Signals, that an error has occurred within the function
block

rows: TRUE, if execution of function block is not finished

Currently active G-code lines.  The first line (index 0) is the G-Code
of the object currently being interpolated.
